description: Triangle of q-binomial coefficients for q=-6.
comments: May be read as a symmetric triangular (T[n,k]=T[n,n-k]; k=0,...,n; n=0,1,...) or square array (A[n,r]=A[r,n]=T[n+r,r], read by antidiagonals).  The diagonals of the former (or rows/columns of the latter) are A000012 (k=0), A014987 (k=1), A015257 (k=2), A015273, A015292, A015310, A015328, A015345, A015361, A015378, A015392 (k=10), A015410, A015429,... - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 04 2012
mathematica: Table[QBinomial[n, k, -6], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 09 2016 *)
prog: (PARI) T015116(n, k, q=-6)=prod(i=1, k, (q^(1+n-i)-1)/(q^i-1)) \\ (Indexing is that of the triangular array: 0 <= k <= n = 0,1,2,...) - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 04 2012
author: _Olivier Gérard_
